readme.summary: Excellent examples and clear purpose, but completely missing installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.

common_complaints: Platform compatibility issues (Windows support missing)

Documentation gaps (network creation, dynamic fixtures)

Feature requests are constructive and include proposed solutions

cves.summary: This affects all versions of package uvicorn. The request logger provided by the package is vulnerable to ASNI escape sequence injection. Whenever any HTTP request is received, the default behaviour o

Uvicorn before 0.11.7 is vulnerable to HTTP response splitting. CRLF sequences are not escaped in the value of HTTP headers. Attackers can exploit this to add arbitrary headers to HTTP responses, or e

readme.summary: The documentation is clear and provides a good quick start, but lacks comprehensive examples and troubleshooting information.

injection_risks.description: The 'app' argument is not validated or sanitized before being used to import the application module. This could potentially lead to a code injection vulnerability if an attacker can manipulate the value of 'app'.
The '--env-file' option allows specifying an environment configuration file. If this file is not properly validated, it could potentially lead to a code injection vulnerability.

security.summary: The uvicorn package has some potential security concerns related to input validation and default configurations, but overall it appears to be a secure library with no critical findings.
